it.polimi.travlendarplus.RESTful.RESTfulCalendar

Class PathRESTful

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.travlendarplus.RESTful.RESTfulCalendar.PathRESTful

  • @Path(value="/path")
public class PathRESTful
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provide all RESTful methods related to handle the user's travel-paths This RESTful resource will be hosted at the relative URI path "/path"

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private User authenticatedUser
      User that performs a request, automatically injected after his authentication
      private PathManager pathManager
      Enterprise Java beans that offers the logic related to path-related functionalities

      PathRESTful()

      This method initialize the injected path manager with the user to be handled It will be executed before any request is actually performed

    • Method Detail

      • postConstruct

        @PostConstruct
public void postConstruct()
        This method initialize the injected path manager with the user to be handled It will be executed before any request is actually performed

      • getBestPathInfo

        @Path(value="{idEvent}")
 @GET
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getBestPathInfo(@PathParam(value="idEvent")
                                                                                                                        long idEvent)
        It allows the user to obtain the information of one path
        Parameters:
        idEvent - the identifier of the event associated to the requested path
        Returns:
        an HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code if the specified event does not exist, an HTTP 409 Conflict response status code if the event is not scheduled ( and so it hasn't a correlated path ) otherwise HTTP 200 OK success status response code and the information of the requested path in the message body

      • swapSchedule

        @Path(value="{idEvent}")
 @PATCH
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response swapSchedule(@PathParam(value="idEvent")
                                                                                                                       long id)
        Allow the user to force in the schedule an event not scheduled
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the event to be forced into the schedule
        Returns:
        an HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code if the identifier of the event does not exist or if the event is already scheduled, otherwise an HTTP 200 OK success status response code with the updated schedule in the message body

      • changeBestPath

        @Path(value="{idNewPath}")
 @POST
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response changeBestPath(@PathParam(value="idNewPath")
                                                                                                                          long idNewPath)
        It allows the user to select one of the alternatives path from the ones he has already obtained
        Parameters:
        idNewPath - identifier of the selected path
        Returns:
        an HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code if the specified path does not exist, or an HTTP 200 OK success status response code with the complete info of the selected path in the message body

      • performAlternativeRequests

        @Path(value="changePath/{eventId}")
 @GET
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response performAlternativeRequests(@PathParam(value="eventId")
                                                                                                                                              long eventId)
        Allows the user to request a list of alternatives path to reach an event
        Parameters:
        eventId - identifier of the event
        Returns:
        an HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code if the specified event does not exist, or an HTTP 200 OK success status response code with the requested paths in the message body

      • getPathDrawingInfo

        @Path(value="map/{idEvent}")
 @GET
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getPathDrawingInfo(@PathParam(value="idEvent")
                                                                                                                               long idEvent)
        It allows the user to retrieve info needed to draw the path into the map
        Parameters:
        idEvent - identifier of the event the path is related to
        Returns:
        an HTTP 400 Bad Request response status code if the specified event does not exist, an HTTP 409 Conflict response status code if the event is not scheduled ( and so it hasn't a correlated path ) otherwise HTTP 200 OK success status response code and the requested information needed in order to draw the path into the map ( in the message body )
